TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives at FAC ( département of NORP ) . He is an officer in the NORP navy .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Maillard caused to be entered in the complaints register of the fleet escort ship D’Estrées the following application for reconsideration of his assessment for DATE :

I … learnt that at senior level and at supreme level my marks had been significantly reduced : for the criterion ‘ standard of service’ the mark had been lowered from CARDINAL to CARDINAL and for the criterion ‘ promotion’ from B to C+ , the whole being accompanied by the following written appraisal : ‘ Is not up to the level that should be achieved by a second in ORG ( or , within a word or CARDINAL , a very similar expression ) . To this day I have been given no explanation of this reduction in marks or of what prompted such a statement .

I consider that this appraisal is excessively severe , unjust and personally offensive . I would refer in this connection to the appraisal made by Commander PERSON , the assessor at immediate - superior level , to the smooth running of the ship during the period on which my assessment was based and to the responsibility I bear under the rules for that smooth running , and , lastly , to the good performance of the D’Estrées during the general inspections of DATE and DATE , attested by the messages of congratulations sent by the admiral commanding the LOC fleet on those occasions .

Furthermore , the appraisal calls in question the wisdom of the decisions of those of my superiors who on CARDINAL occasions saw fit to appoint me to a second - in - command post and the appraisals made by the various commanding officers who assessed me as their second in command .
I accordingly have the honour to request that

( CARDINAL ) the sentence ‘ Is not up to the level that should be achieved by a second in ORG should be deleted . It is an appraisal made not of the standard of my performance which is meant to be the subject of the assessment , but of my person , in a manner which casts a slur on my honour as it is offensive ;

( CARDINAL ) the criteria CARDINAL , DATE ( standard of service and promotion ) and consequently DATE and CARDINAL ( promotion and ‘ ORG at supreme level ) should be raised in consequence , given the implied meaning of the sentence complained of in regard to the level of my service and my promotion potential ; and

( CARDINAL ) once my marks at senior and supreme level have been reassessed , given the effect that my DATE assessment may have under the current rules , on the introductory memorandum submitted by ORG for the competitive examination for entry to ORG , it should be considered whether that reassessment is not such as to justify reconsideration of my failing that examination . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Chief of Staff dismissed the complaint . In a letter of DATE he informed the Commander - in - Chief for the LOC of the fact and requested that the applicant should be notified of it .
CARDINAL . On DATE , having still not received any reply , the applicant had sent his complaint to the Minister of Defence ; it was dismissed in a decision taken by the Minister on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE Mr Maillard applied to the ORG d’Etat for judicial review of those CARDINAL decisions . He filed supplementary pleadings on CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE the ORG d’Etat quashed the decision containing the applicant ’s assessment for DATE and the decisions of DATE and DATE . It gave the following reason :
“ It is unnecessary to consider the grounds of the applications .

According to the provisions of LAW DATE making general regulations for service personnel , as amended by LAW DATE , ‘ service staff shall be assessed at least once a year . The marks and appraisals shall be compulsorily communicated to the service personnel DATE . When the assessment is made , the chief shall make known to each of his subordinates his appraisal of each individual ’s performance’ . The same PERSON provides in LAW that implementing provisions shall be laid down in decrees adopted after consultation of the ORG d’Etat . Similarly , under LAW , the special rules governing professional service personnel must be laid down in a decree adopted after consultation of the ORG d’Etat .

… Mr Maillard ’s assessment for DATE was drawn up according to the procedure of assessment at several successive levels of authority and to an assessment scale laid down in the ministerial directive of CARDINAL DATE concerning the assessment of naval officers . That directive laid down new general rules which govern the implementation of the PERSON and which could therefore only have been lawfully laid down by a decree adopted after consultation of the PERSON d’Etat . It follows that the impugned decision containing Mr Maillard ’s assessment for DATE , together with the ORG decisions whereby the ORG Chief of Staff and thereafter the Minister of Defence refused to revise the assessment , decisions made under rules issued by an authority lacking the necessary competence , are unlawful … ”
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Maillard sent the following letter to the admiral superintendent of NORP naval dockyard :
“ I have the honour to ask you to kindly forward to the higher authorities the present letter in which I am seeking
( CARDINAL ) pursuant to the ORG d’Etat ’s decision [ of DATE ] , to have my assessment for DATE removed from my personal file ;
( CARDINAL ) to be assessed for DATE in accordance with the legal requirements ;

( CARDINAL ) given the substantial damage I have suffered by reason of the impugned assessment , which is evident to me , inter alia , from the fact that since DATE in question I have not been given any post of responsibility at sea ( command or second in command ) , to have my career retrospectively adjusted as laid down in the PERSON d’Etat ’s case - law . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Chief of Staff decided to remove the impugned assessment from the applicant ’s personal file , to draw up and add to that file a new assessment for DATE identical with the first one and to refuse the application for retrospective adjustment of career . On the latter point the Chief of Staff considered that “ the development of [ the applicant ’s ] career [ had ] not been affected by the formal irregularity impugned by the PERSON d’Etat , an irregularity which [ had ] not , in particular , had the consequence of placing this senior officer in circumstances different from those in which the other officers competing with him [ found ] or [ might ] have found themselves ” .
CARDINAL . Mr Maillard complained to ORG of the ORG d’Etat about the difficulties he considered he was encountering in having the judgment of DATE executed .

On DATE the Deputy General Rapporteur replied that the administrative authorities had in fact drawn the appropriate conclusions from the judgment setting aside the first assessment for DATE and that if he wished to challenge the lawfulness of the decision of CARDINAL DATE on its merits , he would have to apply to ORG of the ORG d’Etat .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to the ORG d’Etat for judicial review of the decision of CARDINAL DATE and , consequently , of the CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE establishing the table of command posts for DATE . He produced supplementary pleadings on DATE .

On DATE Mr Maillard lodged another application seeking judicial review of a decision of DATE establishing the table of command posts for DATE and an order that the ORG should pay him the sum of MONEY ( section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL of DATE ) .
CARDINAL . NORP The Minister of Defence filed his defence on DATE . The applicant replied on DATE and produced fresh documents on DATE .
CARDINAL . The reporting judge was appointed on DATE and submitted his report on DATE .
CARDINAL . A preparatory sitting was held on DATE and the hearing took place on DATE .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE the ORG d’Etat quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE on the following ground :
“ It is unnecessary to consider the other grounds …

… under LAW of DATE on the assessment of service personnel , adopted pursuant to the PERSON [ of DATE , as amended , making general regulations for service personnel ] , ‘ service personnel shall be assessed at CARDINAL or more levels by the authorities to which they are subordinate’ . That decree did not come into force until DATE .

It appears from the evidence that while Mr Maillard ’s new assessment for DATE was drawn up according to the procedure of assessment at several successive levels provided for in LAW of DATE on the assessment of service personnel , that decree was not applicable to assessments drawn up for DATE . Moreover , no other provision of service regulations provided for the implementation of such a procedure for DATE . The applicant is accordingly justified in seeking to have his assessment for DATE quashed . Furthermore , the administrative authorities could not lawfully refuse him retrospective adjustment of his career without undertaking a fresh review of his position and his merit . ”
The applicant ’s other claims were dismissed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG reinstated the assessment drawn up in DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant informed ORG of the ORG d’Etat of the difficulties he considered he was encountering in levying execution of the judgments of DATE and DATE . On DATE the Deputy General Rapporteur replied as follows :

After interventions by ORG of the ORG d’Etat ORG informed me in a letter of DATE that your position would be re - examined by the advisory board provided for in section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL of DATE . That board met at DATE and did not agree to a revision of your assessment that would have enabled your superiors to adjust your career retrospectively if appropriate .

That being so , seeing that your assessment for DATE and your career position have been reviewed and a fresh individual assessment decision has been taken by ORG , ORG considers that the authorities have taken the necessary measures to execute the ORG d’Etat ’s judgment [ of CARDINAL DATE ] .
That being so , I can only close your file , without prejudice to the rights you might again have occasion to assert before ORG of the ORG d’Etat .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Maillard applied to the ORG d’Etat seeking , firstly , judicial review of the assessment drawn up on DATE and , secondly , an order for full discovery of a DATE report on his assessment .

On DATE he lodged another application , in which he sought judicial review of CARDINAL decisions taken by the Minister of Defence on DATE establishing , firstly , the promotion table for DATE and , secondly , the table of command posts for DATE .
CARDINAL . The hearing took place on DATE , and in a judgment of DATE the ORG d’Etat quashed the assessment of CARDINAL DATE on the following grounds :

In a decision of DATE the ORG d’Etat , acting in its judicial capacity , quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE whereby Mr Maillard ’s assessment for DATE was determined , on the ground that the assessment had been drawn up according to the procedure of assessment at several successive levels and to an assessment scheme , both of which ( the procedure and the scheme ) had been laid down in a ministerial directive of CARDINAL DATE , setting out general rules , which by sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Law of DATE , as amended , must be enacted in a decree adopted after consultation of the ORG d’Etat . In a decision of DATE the ORG d’Etat , acting in its judicial capacity , quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE whereby Mr Maillard ’s assessment for DATE was redetermined , on the ground that the assessment had been drawn up according to the procedure for assessment at several successive levels which was provided for in LAW of DATE on the assessment of service personnel , although that decree was not applicable to assessments drawn up for DATE and there was no provision in general regulations for the implementation of such a procedure for DATE . Following the quashing of those decisions , it was for the Minister of Defence to take the necessary measures to ensure that Mr Maillard was retrospectively assessed for DATE under the rules then applicable . In the absence of a decree adopted after consultation of the ORG d’Etat as provided in LAW DATE , as amended , it was for the commanding officer of the D’Estrées in DATE , the ship on which Mr Maillard performed the duties of second - in - command , to make that assessment and , if appropriate , for the assessed officer to appeal to a higher authority . Only if it had been impossible to carry out that exercise for factual or legal reasons could the administrative authority have lawfully reviewed Mr Maillard ’s performance for DATE in the sole light of all the information in his file which concerned the assessment period .

… [ W]ithout ascertaining whether it was possible to have PERSON assessment carried out afresh by the commanding officer of the D’Estrées in DATE , ORG , instead of making a fresh assessment of the qualities of the assessed officer for the period in question , did no more than reproduce in full the quashed assessments which had been drawn up by means of a procedure entailing several successive levels of authority , a procedure that had been censured in the aforementioned decisions of the ORG d’Etat . The impugned decision of CARDINAL DATE was accordingly unlawful and must be quashed , without its being necessary to order discovery of the [ report of the ] inquiry by commanding officers as sought by Mr Maillard . ”
The applicant ’s other claims were dismissed .
CARDINAL . In the meantime the assessment complained of had been revised on the basis of reports made in DATE by the commanding officer of the D’Estrées and signed by him .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG had informed the applicant that ORG had reconsidered his file and delivered the following opinion :

“ After making a fresh DATE assessment of Commander PERSON for DATE and looking at the effect of that new assessment on his total marks , ORG finds that the assessment did not have any bearing on his subsequent career and that a retrospective adjustment of his career is not justified . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant had applied to the ORG d’Etat for judicial review of the decision of CARDINAL DATE whereby his application for retrospective adjustment of his career had been refused and of decisions of CARDINAL and DATE establishing the promotions table for DATE and the table of command posts for DATE respectively .

On DATE the President of the Seventh Section of the Judicial Division of the ORG d’Etat made an order striking out the proceedings , on the ground that Mr PERSON had failed to produce within the statutory time the supplementary pleading he had announced in his application .
CARDINAL . Service personnel are not subject to the “ ORG Code ” but to the “ ORG ” ( Law no . CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE , as amended ) .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Law of DATE , as amended , provides :
“ Service personnel shall be assessed at least once DATE .
The marks and appraisals shall be compulsorily communicated to the service personnel DATE .
When making the assessment the chief shall make known to each of his direct subordinates his appraisal of each individual ’s performance . ”

The PERSON provides in LAW that the regulations for its implementation are to be laid down in a decree made after consultation of the ORG d’Etat . The decree relating to assessment was made on DATE ( Decree no . CARDINAL , which came into force on DATE ) ; Article CARDINAL provides :

“ Assessment is an evaluation by the immediate superior of the serviceman ’s moral , intellectual and professional qualities , his physical fitness , his performance during DATE and his ability to occupy higher posts in the immediate future and thereafter .
It takes the form of
General reports ;
Merit levels or marks determined according to a scale or marking scheme respectively , laid down for each service or attached formation in the light of the corps which compose it .
Assessment is distinct from proposals for promotion . ”
Article CARDINAL of the decree provides :
“ The serviceman shall be assessed at CARDINAL or several levels by the authorities to which he is subordinate .

The number of levels of assessment and the designation of the corresponding authorities shall be laid down by the minister responsible for the armed forces in the light of the serviceman ’s corps , grade and function and of the specific organisation of each service or attached formation . ”
CARDINAL . Service personnel have the possibility of challenging their assessments in the administrative courts ( ORG d’Etat , DATE , ORG ) .
